stitch.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a short piece of thread that has been sewn into a piece of cloth, or the action of the thread going into and out of the cloth
stitch.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a piece of special thread which has been used to sew the edges of a wound together
stitch.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: He had to have ten stitches in his head.
stitch.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a sharp pain in the side of your body, which you can get by running or laughing a lot
stitch.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a small circle of wool that is formed around a needle when you are knitting
stitch.translation[0].definitions[3].not: drop a stitch (=lose a stitch because the wool has come off the needle)
stitch.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a particular way of sewing or knitting that makes a particular pattern
stitch.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: Purl and plain are the two main stitches in knitting.
stitch.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to sew two pieces of cloth together, or to sew a decoration onto a piece of cloth
stitch.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The jersey has his name stitched across the back.
